an8.14:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭha ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi aṭṭha ca assadose, aṭṭha ca purisakhaḷuṅke aṭṭha ca purisadose.
an8.14:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you about eight [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms and eight defects in horses, and about eight wild people and eight defects in people.

an8.14:2.1.pli: “Katame ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭha assakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca assadosā?
an8.14:2.1.en: “And what, mendicants, are the eight [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms and eight defects in horses?

an8.14:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṁ pavatteti.
an8.14:2.2.en: Firstly, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms back right up and spin the chariot behind them.

an8.14:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṁ hanati, tidaṇḍaṁ bhañjati.
an8.14:3.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms jump back, wreck the hub, and break the triple rod.

an8.14:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā rathīsāya satthiṁ ussajjitvā rathīsaṁyeva ajjhomaddati.
an8.14:4.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms shake the cart-pole off their thigh and trample it.

an8.14:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṁ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṁ rathaṁ karoti.
an8.14:5.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms take a wrong turn, sending the chariot off track.

an8.14:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā laṅghati purimakāyaṁ paggaṇhati purime pāde.
an8.14:6.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms rear up and strike out with their fore-legs.

an8.14:7.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā anādiyitvā sārathiṁ anādiyitvā patodalaṭṭhiṁ dantehi mukhādhānaṁ vidhaṁsitvā yena kāmaṁ pakkamati.
an8.14:7.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms ignore the trainer and the goad, spit out the bit, and go wherever they want.

an8.14:8.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā neva abhikkamati no paṭikkamati tattheva khīlaṭṭhāyī ṭhito hoti.
an8.14:8.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms don’t step forward or turn back but stand right there still as a post.

an8.14:9.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, idhekacco assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā purime ca pāde saṁharitvā pacchime ca pāde saṁharitvā tattheva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati.
an8.14:9.1.en: Furthermore, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, some [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms tuck in their fore-legs and hind-legs, and sit right down on their four legs.

an8.14:9.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha assakhaḷuṅkā aṭṭha ca assadosā.
an8.14:9.4.en: These are the eight [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms and the eight defects in horses.

an8.14:10.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṁ vatteti;
an8.14:10.4.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, back right up and spin the chariot behind them.

an8.14:11.5.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṁ hanati, tidaṇḍaṁ bhañjati;
an8.14:11.5.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, jump back, wreck the hub, and break the triple rod.

an8.14:12.4.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā rathīsāya satthiṁ ussajjitvā rathīsaṁyeva ajjhomaddati;
an8.14:12.4.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, shake the cart-pole off their thigh and trample it.

an8.14:13.3.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā ummaggaṁ gaṇhati, ubbaṭumaṁ rathaṁ karoti;
an8.14:13.3.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, take a wrong turn, sending the chariot off track.

an8.14:14.3.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā laṅghati, purimakāyaṁ paggaṇhati purime pāde;
an8.14:14.3.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, rear up and strike out with their fore-legs.

an8.14:15.3.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā anādiyitvā sārathiṁ anādiyitvā patodalaṭṭhiṁ dantehi mukhādhānaṁ vidhaṁsitvā yena kāmaṁ pakkamati;
an8.14:15.3.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, ignore the trainer and the goad, spit out the bit, and go wherever they want.

an8.14:16.3.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā neva abhikkamati no paṭikkamati tattheva khīlaṭṭhāyī ṭhito hoti;
an8.14:16.3.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, don’t step forward or turn back but stand right there still as a post.

an8.14:17.6.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅko ‘pehī’ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā purime ca pāde saṁharitvā pacchime ca pāde saṁharitvā tattheva cattāro pāde abhinisīdati;
an8.14:17.6.en: I say that this person is comparable to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms who, when the trainer says ‘giddyup!’ and spurs and goads them on, tuck in their fore-legs and hind-legs, and sit right down on their four legs.

an3.140:1.1.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisakhaḷuṅke.
an3.140:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you about three [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms and three wild people.

an3.140:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:2.2.en: One [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.140:2.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:2.3.en: Another [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.140:2.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.140:2.4.en: While another [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an9.22:1.1.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisakhaḷuṅke tayo ca assaparasse tayo ca purisaparasse tayo ca bhadde assājānīye tayo ca bhadde purisājānīye.
an9.22:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you about three [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms and three wild people; three excellent horses and three excellent people; and three fine thoroughbred horses and three fine thoroughbred people.

an9.22:2.1.en: And what are the three [38;5;121mwild colt[0ms?

an9.22:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti, na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an9.22:2.2.en: One [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an9.22:2.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an9.22:2.3.en: Another [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an9.22:2.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an9.22:2.4.en: While another [38;5;121mwild colt[0m is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an11.9:2.3.en: And how does a [38;5;121mwild colt[0m meditate?

an11.9:2.4.pli: Assakhaḷuṅko hi, saddha, doṇiyā baddho ‘yavasaṁ yavasan’ti jhāyati.
an11.9:2.4.en: A [38;5;121mwild colt[0m, tied up by the feeding trough, meditates: ‘Fodder, fodder!’

an11.9:2.6.pli: Na hi, saddha, assakhaḷuṅkassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṁ hoti:
an11.9:2.6.en: Because it doesn’t occur to the [38;5;121mwild colt[0m tied up by the feeding trough:

an10.87:13.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñcāpi evaṁ icchā uppajjeyya:
an10.87:13.1.en: Suppose a [38;5;121mwild colt[0m was to wish:

thag17.1:28.4.en: like a [38;5;121mwild colt[0m with its charioteer.
